title: Sensing Opportunity in Syria, U.A.E. Leads Arab Efforts to Do Business With Assad
sub_head: Commercial ties multiply a decade after the onset of civil war, as business leaders bet Bashar al-Assad is there to stay
body:
The United Arab Emirates is at the leading edge of an effort in the Arab world to bring Syria in from the cold.
Government officials and business executives from the U.A.E. and Syria say the oil-rich state is attempting to normalize a closer relationship with Bashar al-Assadâ€™s regime, a decade after he was ostracized for his brutal crackdown on opponents and plunging the country into civil war.
